content: If I include a set of .md files in my inputs directory, is there a way to make them appear in the output without listing them explicitly somewhere?
you shouldn't need to list them.
they just won't end up in any ToC
OK, thanks! I just need to figure out what I'm doing wrong then :)

$ find input | grep -i scopes-v2-notes
input/pages/scopes-v2-notes.md

$ find output | grep -i scopes-v2-notes

Here's an example (post-sushi-build) where I have an inputs file but no corresponding outputs.
Specifically: https://github.com/HL7/smart-app-launch/blob/move-to-fsh/fsh/ig-data/input/pages/scopes-v2-notes.md
does the ig say to look for pages in input/pages?
I don't know. It finds other pages there (ones listed in the menu, and ones linked to from pages in the menu).
hmm
For now I'll just add it to my menu... nope, actually that still doesn't work; just creates a broken link in my menu.
maybe this file is special/broken.
is it in your temp directory?
No
er
maybe you mean something different
What does this question mean?
the IG publisher creates a temporary folder from where it runs Jekyll. I want to know if it's in that folder when Jekyll runs

Ah. well, sort of I see it in:

temp/pages/_includes/scopes-v2-notes.md
Trying with a new file though, it all works -- so I think I just have some bug in this file....
it shouldn't be in _includes
(Right, that looks weird.)
OK, the issue seems to be the -notes.md suffix.
Causes the file to get treated differently. Would be awesome if the tooling could blow up instead.
anything with a -notes .md or -intro.md is treated as an include by the templates. so won't show up.
will be included in an conformance artifact page

from an authoring perspective, is it important to be able to put these (intro to conformance) files in the pages directory, or is there a different place where they belong? in other words I'm trying to figure out if there's a way to throw an error rather than silently failing here, or whether the thing I did is actually intended behavior with a defined outcome different than the one I expected.
it's a template thing - I don't have any opinion on this

Per https://fshschool.org/docs/sushi/project/
{artifact-file-name}-intro.xml|md: If present, the contents of the file will be placed on the relevant page before the artifact’s definition.
{artifact-file-name}-notes.xml|md: If present, the contents of the file will be placed on the relevant page after the artifact’s definition.

Moving the notes and intro files to the includes folder would require rejiggering the templates and the scripts.
We could throw an error if a -notes.md doesn't associate with a conformance resource... would need to ask Lloyd.

or you could treat it like any other page in that context. Or you could just document that clearly someplace, though this is the my least favourite answer since there's no way to remove the element of surprise

I can't give a sushi answer, but for non-sushi, all pages that aren't generated artifact pages must be explicitly listed in the IG - that's the only way to know how they should be ordered or what name they should have. And yes "-notes" and "-intro" are treated specially.
You can separate them into an intro-notes folder
